Jim Gilbert wrote:
> It do=
esn't seem to be a standard practice, although I don't know why.  Usually k=
odogu is just displayed for study.  We did tsuba kantei a couple of times i=

here.  Doing kantei kai of mumei items is a little problematic since the "r=
ight" answer is still an opinion rather than a fact.
>

s the handicap of not being able to see everything about the piece, but of =
course that's true too of paper kantei contests for swords.  It could be do=
ne if someone has the time.  It'd be easy enough to Photoshop out signature=
s.
